intro: Cordia incognita, commonly known as the white cordia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Cordia incognita is often found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
